intro: Eriogonum formosum, commonly known as the showy buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces numerous small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eriogonum formosum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
